channel.title: Npc Dialouge?
channel.description: Im in the development of a server :cool: lol. And having trouble make santa talk then talk again after clicking continue <<Need help making him talk after clicking continue>>.

item.title: Npc Dialouge?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Arc Mod Arc
item.description:
@Mod_Arc wrote:

So then how do i add it to my existing Dialogue?
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 18, 2008, 04:14:34 pm[/size][hr][quote=“si force, post:16, topic:251232”]In case 155: You’d add something simular to this to it;

if(NPCID == 1552){ NpcDialogue = 10; NpcDialogueSend = false; }[/quote]

Why is the

NpcDialogueSend = false;

Why is it false?

Read full topic

item.title: Npc Dialouge?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Like so;

case 10:
talk("Hey, What's up?", 1552);
NpcDialogue == 1 || NpcDialogue == 10) {

Then you have your Case 155: .

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mod_Arc Mod Arc
item.description:
@Mod_Arc wrote:

Hmm, im starting to understand but not much so hold on …lol.

So say i have a case umm,

case 10:

And its a NpcDialogue so id add it to the end?

like so?

Npcdialogue = 1 || Npcdialogue = 10;

?

Read full topic

item.title: Npc Dialouge?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:11, topic:251232”]add this method:

public void talk(String text, int npc) {
		sendFrame200(4883, 591);
		sendFrame126(GetNpcName(npc), 4884);
		sendFrame126(text, 4885);
		sendFrame126("Click here to continue.", 4886);
		sendFrame75(npc, 4883);
		sendFrame164(4882);
		NpcDialogueSend = true;
	}
	public void talk2(String text, String text2, int npc) {
		sendFrame200(4901, 591);
		sendFrame126(GetNpcName(npc), 4902);
		sendFrame126("", 4903);
		sendFrame126(text, 4904);
		sendFrame126(text2, 4905);
		sendFrame126("", 4906);
		sendFrame75(npc, 4901);
		sendFrame164(4900);
	}

You should be able to do the rest.[/quote]

On reference to that; That is a much simpler method of it, And it is Easier to use,
For it you’d use;

talk("Hey, What's up?", 1552);

The 1552 is identifying the NPC that is speaking, Though you must still do the Case 40: bit and the Case 155: bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Npc Dialouge?
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

add this method:

public void talk(String text, int npc) {
		sendFrame200(4883, 591);
		sendFrame126(GetNpcName(npc), 4884);
		sendFrame126(text, 4885);
		sendFrame126("Click here to continue.", 4886);
		sendFrame75(npc, 4883);
		sendFrame164(4882);
		NpcDialogueSend = true;
	}
	public void talk2(String text, String text2, int npc) {
		sendFrame200(4901, 591);
		sendFrame126(GetNpcName(npc), 4902);
		sendFrame126("", 4903);
		sendFrame126(text, 4904);
		sendFrame126(text2, 4905);
		sendFrame126("", 4906);
		sendFrame75(npc, 4901);
		sendFrame164(4900);
	}

You should be able to do the rest.

Read full topic

item.title: Npc Dialouge?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

You add it In the First part of the Case:40, At the end of that part of the case, You’ll see something like this;

NpcDialogue += 1;

You add it above that like so;

[quote]case 40:
if (NpcDialogue == 1 || NpcDialogue == 2|| NpcDialogue == 3 || NpcDialogue == 4 || NpcDialogue == 5) {

You add the bit that is highlighted, On case 40: , In the continuous bit it does like say,
If you had Two Npc dialogue methods, One after the other, If you added one the case works so it’s like NpcDialogue == 2, And then another one after that, That is why i posted the last part of the first bit of the method,

It may sound confusing, But it’s really not.

Read full topic
